00060         /**
00061          * Create Domain
00062          * 
00063          * Creates a new domain. The domain name must be unique among the domains associated with the 
00064          * Access Key ID provided in the request. The CreateDomain operation might take 10 or more 
00065          * seconds to complete. 
00066          * 
00067          * @access public
00068          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain to create.
00069          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00070          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00071          * @section example Example Usage:
00072          * @include sdb/create_domain.phps
00073          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_CreateDomain.html
00074          */
00075         public function create_domain($domain_name, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00076         {
00077                 $opt = array();
00078                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00079                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00080 
00081                 return $this->authenticate('CreateDomain', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00082         }
00083 
00084         /**
00085          * List Domains
00086          * 
00087          * Lists all domains associated with the Access Key ID. It returns domain names up to the limit set 
00088          * by MaxNumberOfDomains. A NextToken is returned if there are more than MaxNumberOfDomains domains. 
00089          * Calling ListDomains successive times with the NextToken returns up to MaxNumberOfDomains more 
00090          * domain names each time.
00091          * 
00092          * @access public
00093          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00094          * <ul>
00095          *   <li>integer MaxNumberOfDomains - (Optional) The maximum number of domain names you want returned. The range is 1 to 100.</li>
00096          *   <li>string NextToken - (Optional) String that tells Amazon SimpleDB where to start the next list of domain names.</li>
00097          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00098          * </ul>
00099          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00100          * @section example Example Usage:
00101          * @include sdb/list_domains.phps
00102          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_ListDomains.html
00103          */
00104         public function list_domains($opt = null)
00105         {
00106                 if (!$opt)
00107                 {
00108                         $opt = array();
00109                 }
00110 
00111                 return $this->authenticate('ListDomains', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00112         }

00114         /**
00115          * Delete Domain
00116          * 
00117          * Deletes a domain. Any items (and their attributes) in the domain are deleted as well. The DeleteDomain 
00118          * operation might take 10 or more seconds to complete. Running DeleteDomain on a domain that does not 
00119          * exist or running the function multiple times using the same domain name will not result in an error 
00120          * response.
00121          * 
00122          * @access public
00123          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain to delete.
00124          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00125          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00126          * @section example Example Usage:
00127          * @include sdb/delete_domain.phps
00128          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_DeleteDomain.html
00129          */
00130         public function delete_domain($domain_name, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00131         {
00132                 $opt = array();
00133                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00134                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00135 
00136                 return $this->authenticate('DeleteDomain', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);

00141         // ATTRIBUTES
00142 
00143         /**
00144          * Put Attributes
00145          * 
00146          * Creates or replaces attributes in an item. You specify new attributes using a combination of 
00147          * the Attribute.X.Name and Attribute.X.Value parameters.
00148          * 
00149          * @access public
00150          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain to use.
00151          * @param string $item_name (Required) The name of the item/object to create.
00152          * @param array $keypairs (Required) Associative array of parameters which are treated as key-value and key-multivalue pairs (i.e. a key can have one or more values; think tags).
00153          * @param mixed $replace (Optional) Whether to replace a key-value pair if a matching key already exists. Supports either a boolean (which affects ALL key-value pairs) or an indexed array of key names (which affects only the keys specified). Defaults to boolean false.
00154          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00155          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00156          * @section example Example Usage:
00157          * @include sdb/put_attributes.phps
00158          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_PutAttributes.html
00159          */
00160         public function put_attributes($domain_name, $item_name, $keypairs, $replace = null, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00161         {
00162                 $opt = array();
00163                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00164                 $opt['ItemName'] = $item_name;
00165                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00166                 $rstore = array();
00167 
00168                 // Start looping through the keypairs.
00169                 $count = 0;
00170                 foreach ($keypairs as $k => $v)
00171                 {
00172                         // Is one of the values an array?
00173                         if (is_array($v))
00174                         {
00175                                 // Loop through each of them so that all values are passed as individual attributes.
00176                                 foreach ($v as $va)
00177                                 {
00178                                         $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Name'] = $k;
00179                                         $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Value'] = $va;
00180 
00181                                         // Do we want to do replacement?
00182                                         if ($replace)
00183                                         {
00184                                                 // Do we have an associative array of key names?
00185                                                 if (is_array($replace))
00186                                                 {
00187                                                         // Store this key-index pair for later.
00188                                                         $rstore[] = array(
00189                                                                 'count' => $count,
00190                                                                 'key' => $k
00191                                                         );
00192                                                 }
00193                                                 // Or just a since REPLACE ALL?
00194                                                 else
00195                                                 {
00196                                                         $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Replace'] = 'true';
00197                                                 }
00198                                         }
00199 
00200                                         // Increment
00201                                         $count++;
00202                                 }
00203                         }
00204                         else
00205                         {
00206                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Name'] = $k;
00207                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Value'] = $v;
00208 
00209                                 // Do we want to do replacement?
00210                                 if ($replace)
00211                                 {
00212                                         // Do we have an associative array of key names?
00213                                         if (is_array($replace))
00214                                         {
00215                                                 // Store this key-index pair for later.
00216                                                 $rstore[] = array(
00217                                                         'count' => $count,
00218                                                         'key' => $k
00219                                                 );
00220                                         }
00221                                         // Or just a since REPLACE ALL?
00222                                         else
00223                                         {
00224                                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Replace'] = 'true';
00225                                         }
00226                                 }
00227                         }
00228 
00229                         // Increment
00230                         $count++;
00231                 }
00232 
00233                 // Go through all of the saved key-index pairs we saved earlier.
00234                 foreach ($rstore as $k => $store)
00235                 {
00236                         // Did we want to replace one of these keypairs?
00237                         if (in_array($store['key'], $replace))
00238                         {
00239                                 // Replace!
00240                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $store['count'] . '.Replace'] = 'true';
00241                         }
00242                 }
00243 
00244                 return $this->authenticate('PutAttributes', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00245         }
00246 
00247         /**
00248          * Get Attributes
00249          * 
00250          * Returns all of the attributes associated with the item. Optionally, the attributes returned 
00251          * can be limited to one or more specified attribute name parameters. If the item does not exist 
00252          * on the replica that was accessed for this operation, an empty set is returned. The system 
00253          * does not return an error as it cannot guarantee the item does not exist on other replicas.
00254          * 
00255          * @access public
00256          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain to use.
00257          * @param string $item_name (Required) The name of the item/object to create. This will contain various key-value pairs.
00258          * @param mixed $keys (Optional) The name of the key (attribute) in the key-value pair. Supports a string value (for single keys) or an indexed array (for multiple keys).
00259          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00260          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00261          * @section example Example Usage:
00262          * @include sdb/get_attributes.phps
00263          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_GetAttributes.html
00264          */
00265         public function get_attributes($domain_name, $item_name, $keys = null, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00266         {
00267                 $opt = array();
00268                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00269                 $opt['ItemName'] = $item_name;
00270                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00271 
00272                 if ($keys)
00273                 {
00274                         if (is_array($keys))
00275                         {
00276                                 $count = 0;
00277                                 foreach ($keys as $key)
00278                                 {
00279                                         $opt['AttributeName.' . (string) $count] = $key;
00280                                         $count++;
00281                                 }
00282                         }
00283                         else
00284                         {
00285                                 $opt['AttributeName'] = $keys;
00286                         }
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 return $this->authenticate('GetAttributes', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00290         }
00291 
00292         /**
00293          * Delete Attributes
00294          * 
00295          * Deletes one or more attributes associated with the item. If all attributes of an item are 
00296          * deleted, the item is deleted. If you specify DeleteAttributes without attributes or values, 
00297          * all the attributes for the item are deleted. DeleteAttributes is an idempotent operation; 
00298          * running it multiple times on the same item or attribute does not result in an error response.
00299          * 
00300          * @access public
00301          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain.
00302          * @param string $item_name (Required) The name of the item/object.
00303          * @param mixed $keys (Optional) The name of the key(s) (attribute(s)) to delete from the item. Supports a string value (for single keys), an indexed array (for multiple keys), or an associative array containing one or more key-value pairs (for deleting specific values).
00304          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00305          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00306          * @section example Example Usage:
00307          * @include sdb/delete_attributes.phps
00308          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_DeleteAttributes.html
00309          */
00310         public function delete_attributes($domain_name, $item_name, $keys = null, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00311         {
00312                 $opt = array();
00313                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00314                 $opt['ItemName'] = $item_name;
00315                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00316 
00317                 // Do we have a key?
00318                 if ($keys)
00319                 {
00320                         // An array?
00321                         if (is_array($keys))
00322                         {
00323                                 // Indexed array of Attribute Names?
00324                                 if ($this->util->ready($keys[0]))
00325                                 {
00326                                         for ($x = 0, $i = count($keys); $x < $i; $x++)
00327                                         {
00328                                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $i . '.Name'] = $keys[$i];
00329                                         }
00330                                 }
00331 
00332                                 // Associative array of Name/Value pairs.
00333                                 else
00334                                 {
00335                                         $count = 0;
00336                                         foreach ($keys as $k => $v)
00337                                         {
00338                                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Name'] = $k;
00339                                                 $opt['Attribute.' . (string) $count . '.Value'] = $v;
00340                                                 $count++;
00341                                         }
00342                                 }
00343                         }
00344 
00345                         // Single string Attribute Name.
00346                         else
00347                         {
00348                                 $opt['Attribute.Name'] = $keys;
00349                         }
00350                 }
00351 
00352                 return $this->authenticate('DeleteAttributes', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00353         }

00356         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00357         // QUERY
00358 
00359         /**
00360          * Query
00361          * 
00362          * Returns a set of ItemNames that match the query expression. Query operations that run longer 
00363          * than 5 seconds will likely time-out and return a time-out error response. A Query with no 
00364          * QueryExpression matches all items in the domain.
00365          * 
00366          * @access public
00367          * @param string $domain_name (Required) The name of the domain to use.
00368          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00369          * <ul>
00370          *   <li>integer MaxNumberOfItems - (Optional) The maximum number of item names you want returned. The range is 1 to 250, defaults to 100.</li>
00371          *   <li>string NextToken - (Optional) String that tells Amazon SimpleDB where to start the next list of domain names.</li>
00372          * </ul>
00373          * @param string $expression (Optional) The SimpleDB query expression to use.
00374          * @param boolean $follow (Optional) Whether to take the next step and fetch the items that are returned. Defaults to false.
00375          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00376          * @section example Example Usage:
00377          * @include sdb/query.phps
00378          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonSimpleDB/2007-11-07/DeveloperGuide/SDB_API_Query.html
00379          */
00380         public function query($domain_name, $opt = null, $expression = null, $follow = null)
00381         {
00382                 if (!$opt)
00383                 {
00384                         $opt = array();
00385                 }
00386 
00387                 $opt['DomainName'] = $domain_name;
00388                 $opt['QueryExpression'] = $expression;
00389 
00390                 $query = $this->authenticate('Query', $opt, SDB_DEFAULT_URL);
00391 
00392                 // If $follow is requested, and there's at least one response to follow...
00393                 if ($follow && isset($query->body->QueryResult->ItemName))
00394                 {
00395                         $handles = array();
00396 
00397                         foreach ($query->body->QueryResult->ItemName as $item)
00398                         {
00399                                 $handles[] = $this->get_attributes($domain_name, $item, null, true);
00400                         }
00401 
00402                         $request = new $this->request_class(null);
00403                         return $request->sendMultiRequest($handles);
00404                 }
00405 
00406                 return $query;
00407         }
00408 }
